header.title: Tennis sexism row: Alize Cornet rapped for changing her top - she BREAKS SILENCE
header.subtitle: TENNIS officials were criticised yesterday after a female player was hit with an official warning at the US Open for removing her top on court.
header.postText: 'French world No 31 Alize Cornet was accused of unsportsmanlike behaviour after she briefly took off her shirt, exposing her sports bra, when she saw it was on back-to-front.', 'Cornet, 28, had returned to court after a “heat break” as temperatures soared to 100F (38C) at Flushing Meadows in New York on Tuesday.', 'Tournament organisers last night expressed their regret at the ruling and said all players were allowed to change their shirts on court but should do it when sitting in their chair between games.', 'The clarification came after leading figures in the sport accused officials of double standards as top male players regularly remove their shirts in view of the crowd.', 'Judy Murray, mother of tennis champ Sir Andy, tweeted: Alize Cornet came back to court after 10 minute heat break. Had her fresh shirt on back to front. Changed at back of court. Got a code violation. Unsportsmanlike conduct...but the men can change shirts on court.', 'Cornet spoke later of the controversy, she said: For sure, the women are treated a little bit differently, admitted Cornet, who ended up losing her first-round match to Sweden's Johanna Larsson.', 'I think it gets much better,especially in the tennis.', 'I want to be clear about it and I didn't take it that bad. I was just maybe disturbed for 10 seconds and that was it.'
